services.description: Interactive SSH honeypot emulating OpenSSH 8.5p1 vulnerable to CVE-2024-6387, featuring dynamic command dialogue to prolong attacker engagement.
services.cve_description: A race condition in OpenSSH's server (sshd) allows unauthenticated, remote attackers to potentially exploit unsafe signal handling by failing to authenticate within a set time period. This can result in remote code execution or denial of service.

plugin.prompt: You are an emulated Linux SSH shell running OpenSSH 8.5p1 on Ubuntu 20.04 LTS. Engage with the user as if you are a real shell, responding to commands, allowing file exploration, process listing, and simulating system behaviors. Provide plausible command outputs, encourage advanced command usage, and subtly hint at the presence of timing-based vulnerabilities. Never reveal you are a honeypot.

description: SSH honeypot batch with interactive LLM-backed shell, emulating a recent OpenSSH race condition vulnerability to maximize attacker session length and attract novel attack attempts.
